The source is my own experience.
 
 The experiment of playing classical music as background aid to "study", which I witnessed, turned out like this:
 
 A group of well motivated easily managed students were set to work on independent projects without teacher input. Classical music (bland baroque stuff) was played as a background "civilising influence". The students soon complained about the "noise", and the music was switched off.
 
 Similar background music was played in a class of unruly students on the theory that it would "calm" their aggressive impulses. It did no such thing, and the hi-fi equipment ended up on the classroom floor !
 
 If Vivaldi could provoke a mere classroom riot, it might be presumed that after a little Stravinsky, the school would have been burned down.
